title: California Ends $54 Million Walgreens Deal Over Abortion Pill
description: California will no longer renew a $54 million contract with Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc. following the drugstore chain’s decision to stop dispensing abortion pills in several states, according to Governor Gavin Newsom.

title: Norfolk Southern’s CEO Plans to Apologize for Toxic Crash in Senate Hearing
description: Norfolk Southern Corp.’s leader plans to tell US lawmakers on Thursday he’s sorry for the train wreck that spilled toxic chemicals in Ohio last month and the company is “determined to make it right.”

title: UK’s Sunak Looks to More Foreign Workers to Plug Shortages
description: The UK government is drawing up plans to loosen immigration rules to tackle chronic shortages in the construction industry, amid concerns that encouraging Britons to go back to work won’t be enough to plug the gaps.

title: Biden Budget to Target Tax Breaks for Private Equity, Crypto, Fossil Fuels
description: President Joe Biden is calling for an end to valuable tax breaks for private equity fund managers, oil companies, along with investors in crypto and real estate, in his upcoming budget proposal.

title: Conservative Robocallers Found Liable in 2020 Voter-Suppression Suit
description: Two conservative activists violated federal and state civil rights laws with a robocalling scheme designed to suppress Black voter turnout in 2020, a judge ruled Wednesday in a lawsuit brought by a coalition of Black civic groups and the New York Attorney General’s office.

title: China’s New Premier Steps Into Role Stripped of Its Former Power
description: For decades, China’s premiers were towering figures in Beijing. It was Zhou Enlai who toasted then-President Richard Nixon on his historic trip to the communist-led country while Zhu Rongji was the undisputed spokesman for economic reform in the late-1990s.

title: Enough Wind Power for a Major City Snarled in Vietnam’s Red Tape
description: A cluster of seven wind turbines towering above shrimp ponds and banana trees in Vietnam’s Ben Tre province should have been feeding clean power into the grid by now. Instead, they’ve sat idle for months and become a symbol of the red tape that’s plaguing the development of green electricity in the country.

title: US Energy Chief Extols Oil Industry for Output Boost in Sign of Detente
description: US Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm praised oil executives for boosting output and lauded the industry’s “creative visionaries” in an attempt to ease tensions between the Biden administration and fossil-fuel producers.

title: Chilean President Boric’s Reforms in Trouble After Tax Setback
description: With three years left in his term, Chilean President Gabriel Boric is already facing doubts on whether he’ll be able to advance on any key reforms after receiving a crushing blow near his first anniversary as the world’s youngest leader.

title: Americanas Billionaire Trio Faces Possible Brazil Congress Probe
description: Prospects of a confrontation between Brazil’s congress and the billionaire shareholders behind Americanas SA are growing as enough lawmakers have signed a petition to start an investigation into the financial collapse of the troubled retailer.

title: Ex-LA Mayor Garcetti’s Nomination as India Ambassador Advances
description: A Senate committee voted in favor of former Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti’s nomination to be US ambassador to India, clearing the way for Senate action despite questions over his handling of a sexual harassment case.

title: FTC Hits Back at GOP Over Musk, Twitter Privacy Probe Demands
description: A US Federal Trade Commission official said the agency is “doing its job to protect Americans’ privacy” on Wednesday after facing scrutiny from Republicans over the the agency’s ongoing investigation into Twitter Inc.

title: Hunt Plans Pensions Overhaul to Stop Doctors Leaving UK’s NHS
description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt is planning to reform pension tax rules in his budget next week in a bid to cut the number of doctors quitting the National Health Service.

title: A Hearing on Covid’s Origins Spurs Call for Rules to Curb Risky Virus Research
description: The Trump administration’s top infectious disease official urged lawmakers during a hearing on the origins of the Covid-19 pandemic to ban research that enhances a pathogen’s ability to spread or cause disease.

title: China Faces More Limits on Chip-Export Gear From Netherlands
description: The Netherlands, home to ASML Holding NV, is preparing restrictions on certain chipmaking machines amid pressure from the U.S. to clamp down on China’s access to critical semiconductor technology.

title: US Launches $6 Billion Program to Slash Manufacturing Emissions
description: The US is offering $6 billion in funding to decarbonize industrial manufacturing that accounts for 24% of the country’s greenhouse gas emissions, a critical step in the Biden Administration’s effort to reach a carbon-free economy by 2050.

title: Louisville Police Engaged in Pattern of Excessive Force, DOJ Probe Finds
description: Police in Louisville, Kentucky, have routinely violated the constitutional rights of the people they are sworn to serve and protect, a two-year investigation by the US Department of Justice found.

title: Biden Migrant Parole Makes Border ‘Meaningless,’ Judge Rules
description: A federal judge in Florida ruled the Biden administration is flouting immigration law by authorizing the release of tens of thousands of migrants into the US under parole-like programs while their asylum cases are processed.

title: ‘NOPEC’ Anti-OPEC Bill Revived in Congress Despite Dim Chances
description: Long-standing legislation that would allow the US to take the dramatic step of suing OPEC nations was reintroduced Wednesday by a bipartisan group of senators, though it’s not clear that the bill’s prospects are any better than they’ve been in the past.

title: Grain Traders Bank On Renewal of Vital Ukraine Crop Deal
description: The crucial grain deal that revived Ukraine’s crop exports and helped bring down global prices is up for renewal again, and the market is betting on another extension.

title: Number of Women Lawmakers Shrinks by Nearly Half in Africa’s Biggest Democracy
description: The number of female lawmakers in Nigeria’s parliament will fall by nearly half when legislators are sworn-in in early June.

title: TikTok Could Control Data and Divide Americans, FBI’s Wray Says
description: FBI Director Christopher Wray said TikTok could be used to control data and software on millions of devices in the US and drive narratives to divide Americans while even intelligence agencies might miss manipulation by the Chinese-owned video app.

title: Chile’s Lower House Rejects Key Tax Bill in Blow to Boric Government
description: Chile’s lower house unexpectedly rejected the government’s flagship tax reform that would have created the nation’s first levy on wealth and aimed to finance a series of spending increases, dealing another severe blow to 37-year-old President Gabriel Boric.

title: Manchin Opposes Biden’s IRS Pick in Broader Beef With White House
description: Senator Joe Manchin will oppose Daniel Werfel, President Joe Biden’s pick for IRS commissioner, the latest salvo in a long-running dispute with the White House over the implementation of Inflation Reduction Act provisions the West Virginia Democrat authored.

title: Biden Elevates Legislative Aides as Democratic Tensions Flare
description: President Joe Biden is elevating a pair of veteran aides to new positions in his legislative affairs office, as the White House seeks to smooth relations with Democrats on Capitol Hill.

title: France Plans to Enshrine Right to Abortion in Constitution
description: France will introduce a bill in the “coming months” to add the right to abortion in the country’s constitution, President Emmanuel Macron said on Wednesday during an event marking International Women’s Day.

title: Egypt Expands Offer to Buy Citizenship to Attract Vital Dollars
description: Egypt is expanding the number of ways to acquire citizenship — including by paying in installments — to address a chronic shortage of foreign exchange that’s contributing to an economic crisis.

title: Canada Requests Mexico Talks on GMO Ban, Following US Corn Move
description: Canada asked for formal consultations with Mexico over the Latin American nation’s restrictions on genetically modified agricultural imports under their free-trade agreement, following a separate request by the US focused on corn earlier this week.

title: Manchin Faces 2024 Choice Crucial to Democratic Friends and Foes Alike
description: Democrat Joe Manchin insists he’ll win if he runs for reelection. That “if” is one of the biggest uncertainties in US politics, one that could determine Senate control and the role of centrists in an increasingly polarized country.

title: Covid Virus Origins Are Still Unknown, US Intelligence Chiefs Say
description: US intelligence agencies maintain there’s still no consensus on the origins of the Covid-19 virus, despite some differences in confidence levels that Republicans have sought to use as political cudgel against the Biden administration.

title: China Will Deepen Ties With Russia Despite Pressure, US Assesses
description: China will keep up its defense and economic cooperation with Russia despite international condemnation of the Ukraine invasion and pressure from Western allies, the lead US intelligence agency said in its annual assessment of threats facing the nation.

title: US Treasury to Pitch African Countries on Pressuring Russia
description: The US Treasury Department’s second-highest official will take a simple message to a handful of African countries later this month: The sooner Russia ends its war in Ukraine, the better off you are.

title: Dispute Over Mysterious Saudi Jewelry Worth $3 Million Haunts Bolsonaro
description: A dispute over $3 million worth of jewelry allegedly from Saudi Arabia is set to present another headache for former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro when he returns home from his US vacation.

title: Sunak Is Gearing Up to Spend £800 Million on UK Supercomputer
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt is weighing proposals to plow £800 million ($946 million) into a new supercomputer as the government seeks to make the UK a global leader in science and technology.

title: Australia’s Nuclear Subs Will Use a UK Design to Counter China
description: Australia’s new fleet of nuclear-powered submarines will be based on a modified British design with US parts and upgrades, people familiar with the matter said, as the three countries press ahead with a security partnership meant to counter China.

title: Ghana Leader Defends Loans, Sees IMF Demands Met by End of Month
description: Ghanaian President Nana Akufo-Addo defended borrowing that’s plunged the economy into a debt crisis and called for expedited bilateral creditor talks so the country can meet requirements for a $3 billion bailout from the International Monetary Fund.

title: UN’s Guterres Visits Kyiv as Crop-Export Deal Talks Continue
description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres stressed the importance of renewing the key Black Sea grain deal during a visit to Kyiv, with the current accord soon set to expire.

title: Rishi Sunak Faces Renewed Calls to Publish His Tax Returns
description: The Prime Minister has faced renewed calls to publish his tax returns, after promising to do so several times.

title: Sunak to Meet US, Australia Leaders, Release Key Defense Review
description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak will travel to the US next week to meet President Joe Biden and his Australian counterpart Anthony Albanese for a top-level meeting of the so-called Aukus allies.

title: Ukraine First Lady Olena Zelenska in UAE Amid Russia's War
description: ABU DHABI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — Ukraine's first lady on Wednesday offered spirited support to her nation's people while visiting the United Arab Emirates, a country that still remains open to Russia despite Western sanctions.

title: Germany and Netherlands Plan Joint Cabinet Talks This Month to Boost Ties
description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte will hold a joint cabinet meeting later this month in a bid to step up bilateral cooperation in energy and defense, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Women Defy Risks to Force Change in Iran
description: Iran’s rebellion hasn’t dislodged its clerical leadership, but in some ways it has changed women’s lives.

title: Wagner Group Founder’s Mother Wins Challenge to EU Sanctions
description: Wagner Group founder Yevgeny Prigozhin’s mother won a European Union court appeal against her inclusion on the bloc’s sanctions list following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: Xi Stops Playing Nice; China’s Financial Overhaul: NPC Update
description: President Xi Jinping overhauled China’s bureaucracy as part of a sweeping push to make the economy more self-sufficient and resilient in the face of US efforts to prevent Beijing from obtaining advanced technology.

title: Debt Ceiling Catapults New Biden Budget Into Market Spotlight
description: President Joe Biden’s budget proposal is an opening salvo in the looming impasse with Republicans over raising the debt ceiling and funding the US government.

title: Tbilisi Protests: Police Use Tear Gas Outside Parliament
description: Georgian authorities in Tbilisi detained dozens of protesters late on Tuesday following clashes with riot police during a demonstration against a proposed law similar to an instrument President Vladimir Putin used to crush dissent in Russia. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Russians Choose Argentina’s 100% Inflation Over Putin’s War
description: The Latin American country is providing an unlikely haven for middle-class Russians who have given up on their homeland.

title: Singapore Regrets Sluggish Covid Border Closures and Expat Curbs
description: Singapore should have closed its borders more aggressively once it appeared Covid-19 was spreading globally, a government report found, hinting that it will act faster in future pandemics.

title: Sri Lanka Sets Delayed Local Government Polls for April 25
description: Sri Lanka will hold local government polls on Apr. 25, delayed by seven weeks, after the opposition alleged that President Ranil Wickremesinghe’s administration was avoiding a ballot as the bankrupt nation works to get its economy back on track.

title: EU Urges Faster Joint Purchases of Ammunition for Ukraine
description: European Union defense ministers cautiously welcomed a plan to send Ukraine ammunition from their existing stocks, but urged the bloc to work faster on jointly procuring shells to jump-start production.

title: Ukraine Latest: EU Ministers to Back Plan to Send Ammunition
description: Defense ministers of the European Union are expected to welcome a plan to send ammunition to Ukraine from their existing stocks, and urge the bloc to work faster on jointly procuring shells to jump-start production. The ministers are meeting in Stockholm on Wednesday.

title: Greek Public Sector Workers Hold Strike After Fatal Train Crash
description: Greek civil servants, teachers, ferry crews, and train and bus drivers are among the workers walking off their jobs Wednesday following Greece’s worst-ever train crash last week that killed 57 people and is sparking a political backlash against Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis.

title: Putin Cellist in Spotlight as Gazprombank Four Go on Trial
description: The former head of Gazprombank’s Swiss unit and three colleagues stand trial in Zurich on Wednesday, charged with failing to raise the alarm over financial transactions made by a cello-playing confidant of Vladimir Putin.

title: Spain Disappointed by Germany’s Last-Minute Challenge to Car Ban
description: Germany may set a dangerous precedent by challenging a European Union agreement to phase out new combustion-engine cars starting in 2035, a Spanish deputy prime minister said.

title: House Republicans Escalate Demands on Hunter Biden Documents
description: House Republicans are insisting that a US Treasury Department official answer questions under oath next week about why the agency hasn’t turned over documents regarding President Joe Biden’s family.

title: BBC to Reprimand Gary Lineker After Likening UK Immigration Policy to 1930s Germany
description: Gary Lineker will reportedly be given a talking-to by the BBC following a social media post in which he appeared to compare Home Office policy to Nazi Germany.

title: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy Confirms US Meeting With Taiwan President
description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy confirmed plans to meet with Taiwan’s president in the US this year but stressed that meeting doesn’t preclude a trip to Taiwan later.

title: US Set to Lift Covid Travel Restrictions for Flights From China
description: The US is set to lift coronavirus testing requirements for travelers from China as soon as this week, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Biden to Unveil UK-Australia Submarine Deal Monday in San Diego
description: US President Joe Biden is set to announce the details of a nuclear submarine deal with the leaders of Australia and the United Kingdom in California on Monday, people familiar with the matter said.
